title: 20,000 Leagues Under the Sea
description: An escape room based on Jules Vern's classic adventure.

children.value: Dear explorers and adventurers, I will not give you my name as you will not have heard of me. However, I am writing to you because I believe we have a shared interest relating to an item which recently came into your possession.
A two room escape game I built in my house for friends and family, based on the novel by Juels Verne.
Plot and puzzle overview
Players are invited aboard the Nautilus to join the mysterious Captain Nemo in his quest to discover the Lost City of Atlantis.

props.alt: A pile of four letters, the front one reads 'Mobilis In Mobile - N'
props.title: Some of the letters and documents guests can uncover

children.value: The first half of the game takes place in Nemo's quarters where players must solve a series of riddles to prove to Nemo they have what it takes. Then they pool resources to locate Atlantis.

props.alt: Wooden boxes, metal code boxes, scales with bottles
props.title: A selection of props and puzzles from Nemo's quatres

children.value: Players then travel through a hidden airlock to enter an ethereal and smoke filled Atlantan cave. Once in this strange new world  must decipher various inscriptions and solve ancient puzzles. Doing so reveals the secret of Atlantis, but unleashes a terrible monster.

props.alt: A stone grid of three by three holes has wooden block or various heights slot into them
props.title: Players must arrange the

children.value: The players must flee back the Nautilus and solve a simple final puzzle to defend to Nautilus from the monster before returning home victorious.
Technical details
The whole game is managed with a custom Node-Red dashboard that links the various devices.

I created an audio player in Python which is controlled by MQTT, this can play various ambient sound scapes, music, and sound effects. I also created web-based video player that is controlled by websocets, this can play looping videos and also overlay other videos using different blending modes.
Entrance way
Three separate audio scapes play from different speakers, controlled by websockets.
Nemo's office
Zigbee controlled lighting for electrical surge effects and flashing alarms.
Audio player for looping ambiance and various sound effects. And voice intercom to deliver live messages from the captain running Mumla server.
Atlantis
Audio player featuring looping ambiance, various sound effects, and music.
Projector displaying caustic water effect on the ceiling, also triggered to playing moving machine parts, and monster shadows.
Pi Pico controlled LEDs with custom random pulsing animation to look like otherworldly insects, also pulses red in time with music during escape.
Pi Pico controlled UV lamp can be turned on/off or play a short flickering animation.
Pi Pico controlled 'tipper' device uses a stepper motor to release four wooden block from the ceiling.
